scenarioDescription:
The WASP-153 Exoplanetary System


Overview

WASP-153 is a star with 1.34 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.73 times its radius. It is located 1990.13 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

WASP-153 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the WASP-153 system


WASP-153 b

WASP-153 b was discovered by the SuperWASP observatory, in 2018-03, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of WASP-153 b is 124.020 times the mass of Earth. The radius of WASP-153 b is 17.374 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, WASP-153 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system WASP-153, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the SuperWASP.
name: WASP-153 - System With 1 Exoplanet
